snippet: The Nusra Front, the Syrian branch of Al Qaeda, said it had seized more than 40 peacekeepers because the United Nations failed to help the people of Syria during the country’s civil war.
abstract: Nusra Front, Syrian branch of Al Qaeda, confirms that it has seized more than 40 United Nations peacekeepers in southern Syria; group has not issued demands for the release of the captured peacekeepers.

byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Istanbul, Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem and Somini Sengupta from New York.

lead_paragraph: The Nusra Front, the Syrian branch of Al Qaeda, said it had seized more than 40 peacekeepers because the United Nations failed to help the people of Syria during the country’s civil war.

headline.main: Affiliate of Al Qaeda Confirms Capture of U.N. Peacekeepers in Syria
headline.print_headline: Confirming It Holds 45, Qaeda Group Blames U.N.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: United Nations Department of Peacekeeping Operations
keywords.name: organizations
